page.title: 02CLUBS: CRICKET AND RUGBY
page.content: {Adlestrop Cricket Club}was founded about 1870. The ground, now leased to the club, stands in the grounds of Lord Leigh's estate. The present pavilion was built in 1964 and has recently been extended. Many of the matches are against local clubs but also include touring teams from this country and abroad. It is one of the few cricket clubs to have a oak tree growing on the field. {Stow-on-the-Wold Rugby Football Club was founded over 100 years ago and purchased its present 12.5 acre site in 1970. This land provides space for two playing pitches and a club house which gives excellent facilities for playing and social activities. Three teams play regularly, and sometimes a fourth, involving more than 70 players drawn from a wide rural area.
